sentences.english: The supplies of sugar have been running low,causing a rise in the price.
sentences.chinese: 糖的供应日渐短缺，从而引起价格的上涨。

sentences.english: In addition there is a notable shortage of traffic police in mainland China.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还有一个显着短缺，交通警在大陆。

sentences.english: Fund shortage restricts the development of col leges and universities.
sentences.chinese: 资金短缺是制约高校发展的主要原因。

sentences.english: They only let me out on patrol when they're shorthanded .
sentences.chinese: 很多人这个月休假中，所以我们有一点人手短缺。

sentences.english: Your shipment of goods has been found short in weight by re-inspection.
sentences.chinese: 经再次检验发现贵方装运的货物重量短缺了。

sentences.english: Most of the North Koreans we spoke with said they were fleeing poverty and food shortages.
sentences.chinese: 大多数北韩人都说他们在逃离贫困和食物短缺。

sentences.english: She expected a shortage of dried fruit so she laid in a large supply.
sentences.chinese: 她预期果脯会有短缺，所以囤积了一大批。

sentences.english: Some also face a shortage of expertise.
sentences.chinese: 一些公司也面临着专门人才的短缺。

sentences.english: Cheng. He expects a shortage of TBR tires won't end any time soon.
sentences.chinese: 他预计TBR轮胎短缺的局面近期内不会结束。

sentences.english: Coordinate with production to aviod shortage and over production.
sentences.chinese: 配合生产部分严格控制产品的短缺和过量生产。

sentences.english: China is short of water resources. The distribution of water resources is uneven.
sentences.chinese: 中国水资源短缺，水资源分布不均衡。

sentences.english: As you may be aware, there is a UK shortage and the waiting lists are very long.
sentences.chinese: 如你所知，英国供应短缺并且有一个很长的轮候名单。

sentences.english: There is a shortage of 1,450 pounds in this shipment.
sentences.chinese: 这批运输的货物短缺1450磅。

sentences.english: We are sorry for the brief delivery.
sentences.chinese: 我们为交货量短缺向贵公司致歉。

sentences.english: Hence the severe shortage of credit and predictions of worse to come.
sentences.chinese: 因此更严重的信贷短缺和更坏的预期将会到来。

sentences.english: Now I've heard a lot of scuttlebutt about a food shortage.
sentences.chinese: 我听了很多关于食物短缺的闲话。

definition: very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
to furnish/to provide/supply (as in supply and demand)
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
property or cash held in reserve/stock
